org.cooperari.core

Class CCoverageLog

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cooperari.core.CCoverageLog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CCoverage

    public final class CCoverageLog
extends Object
implements CCoverage
    Coverage log. An object of this kind maintains a log of yield point coverage.
    Since:
    0.2

      • recordDefinition

        public void recordDefinition(CYieldPoint yp)
        Record definition of yield point. The yield point is not marked as covered. If the yield point is already defined, the call is ignored and the coverage status is unchanged.
        Parameters:
        yp - Yield point.

      • markAsCovered

        public void markAsCovered(CYieldPoint yp)
        Mark a yield point as covered.
        Parameters:
        yp - Yield point.

      • enrich

        public void enrich(CCoverageLog otherLog,
                   boolean ignoreCoverageStatus)
        Enrich this log with information from other log. The following contract applies:
        • This log is enriched only for yield points occurring in source files it already references, but that are not known yet. Yield points in the other log that related to other source files are ignored.
        • For each yield point of the kind above, the coverage status in the other log may be ignored or not, according to the ignoreStatus parameter value:
          • if true: the yield point will only be marked as defined (uncovered thus), regardless of the coverage status in the other log
          • if false: the yield point will be marked as defined and also as covered if it is marked as covered in the other log;
        Parameters:
        otherLog - The other log.
        ignoreCoverageStatus - Ignore coverage status from the other log.

      • produceCoverageReport

        public File produceCoverageReport(String dirName,
                                  String reportId)
                           throws IOException
        Generate a coverage report.
        Parameters:
        dirName - Directory name inside workspace.
        reportId - Report id.
        Returns:
        File object for the coverage report.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
